cheatsheet.title: Generating an Extended EMF Model

intro.description:
This cheat sheet is a step-by-step description of generating an extended EMF model and model editor from Rose file.
This cheat sheet requires an existing library model and editor in your workspace. If they are not generated, please refer to one of the "Generating an EMF Model" cheatsheets for details.

cheatsheet.onCompletion: Congratulations you have succesfully created an Extended EMF model from a UML specification described in Rose, generated the code, and created instances of the model.

item.title: Set Up the Environment
item.description: Your environment must be set up so you can perform the steps of this cheat sheet.

subitem.label: Download "schoollibrary.mdl" to the directory of your workspace.
Delete or rename the following projects if they exist in your workspace:"schoollibrary.rose","schoollibrary.rose.edit","schoollibrary.rose.editor"

item.title: Import the Model from Rose
item.description: First, you must create a new library EMF project in your workspace, where the model to be generated is defined in a Rose file.

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Project...". Expand "Eclipse Modeling Framework" and select "EMF Project". Then, click "Next".
Enter "schoollibrary.rose" as "Project name", then click "Next".
Select "Rose class model", then click "Next".
Click "Browse File System...", locate the workspace folder and select the downloaded Rose model file "schoollibrary.mdl".
Enter "schoollibrary.genmodel" for "Generator model file name", then click "Next".
Select "schoollibrary" package, then click "Browse".
Expand "Workspace", expand "library" and select "model". Select the generator file "library.genmodel", then click "Ok".
In the "Referenced generator models" section, expand "Library" model, and select the "Library" package. Then, click "Finish".

item.title: Generate the EMF Model and Editor Code
item.description: Before the code can be ran by Eclipse the EMF Model and Editor Code must be generated and compiled.

subitem.label: In the generator, right click on "Schoollibrary" and select "Generate All".
If project is not build automatically, then select "Project->Build All" to compile the generated code.
Select "Source->Organize Imports" to remove unused imports.

item.title: Run the Generated Editor
item.description: Now, you are set to run the generated editor to created new library models.

subitem.label: Select "Run->Run As->Eclipse Application" to run a new instance of Eclipse with the newly generated editor.
Create a general project: "schoollibrarytest".
Right click "schoollibrarytest" and select "New->Other...".
Expand "Example EMF Model Creation Wizards" and select "Schoollibrary Model". Then, click "Next".
Enter "My.schoollibrary" as filename, then click "Next".
Select "School Library" as model object, then click "Finish".

In "Resource Set", expand "platform:/resource/schoollibrarytest/My.schoollibrary". Right click "School Library" and select "New Child->School Book" to create a School Book object in School Library model.

item.title: Modify the Editor
item.description: This will show how to modify the code that gets generated. You will change a label in the generated editor, then regenerate the code.

subitem.label: In the school library generator model, select the "SchoolLibrary" class. Right click and select "View Properties".
In the "Properties View", change the "Label Feature" to "location : EString".
Right click "SchoolLibrary" class and select "Generate Edit Code".
